description: Are you in the market for a Chrome bumper C3 corvette, but are having a tough time deciding between a Numbers Matching car or a Resto-mod? Your search might be over with this gorgeous white 1970 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray. While it's powered by the numbers matching 454ci V8 and the numbers matching auto transmission, today if you lifted the hood you would see a much different look than the way it left the factory.

The original 454 has been bored and stroked to a 496ci V8. The 4-bolt main features a balanced crank, H-beam rods, aluminum pistons, Moroso deep oil pan with windage tray, General Motors 074 aluminum heads, Comp Cams Hydraulic roller cams, aluminum intake and a Holley 770 Carburetor. But don't make the assumption that this is some monster horsepower build. The idea behind the build was to improve on what was already there and give it a little more pep, all while keeping it something that could be enjoyed on the streets. This is why you'll also find a Be-cool aluminum radiator with twin-electric fans, Hydro power brake booster, 200 amp alternator, Vintage A/C, High Volume fuel pump and a Monster high-torque starter.

But it didn't stop in just the engine bay, glance at the underneath pictures and you'll find an upgraded front and rear suspension from the folks at VBP suspensions with Neoprene bushings, composite rear springs, new front springs, Bilstein shocks and upgraded 4-wheel disc brakes with new plumbing and a 3.90 posi rear gear..

The car was repainted in its original Classic White factory color in 2008. Ten years later, and the car still stands very tall. The coated side pipes accent the white very well. The paint does show minor daily driver flaws, but nothing that would keep you from proudly displaying this car at your local car shows.

Pop open the doors and you'll find an interior that continues the modern/original theme. On the floor you'll see new carpet that has new insulation under it. New leather seat covers are fixed on the seats in front of the new dash and door components. For music you'll notice that a new AM/FM/CD player sends tunes through a power amp and an upgraded speaker bar at the rear of the car.

If you are looking for a 100% original car that transports you back to the dealership went it arrived new... This isn't the car for you. However, if you are looking for a Vette that drives better than the way it left the factory and has a little more horsepower available, but still has the original big ticket items, then this is your car. Don't miss out on your chance to own this collectible!

This 1969 Chevy Corvette Convertible is an American Classic. It has a small block 350 V8 mated to a 4spd manual transmission with a short throw Hurst shifter. It drives very well on Rally wheels with radial tires. Solid frame and new exhaust. Vacuum operated equipment work.

For sale in our Dallas Fort Worth showroom is this beastly 1971 Chevrolet Corvette. Powered by what is believed to be the original LS-5 454 big block Chevrolet V8 engine factory rated at 365 horsepower this Bridgehampton Blue fiberglass coupe performance machine is a rocket. With the 4-speed manual transmission you are always able to get yourself right in the sweet spot for making power. This bad little blue bowtie exhales through dual exhaust with a vintage big block burble that will throw you back to yesteryear. Rip off the t-tops and enjoy the open air or drive this one as a fair weather cruiser either way this Corvette is an iconic machine. The black interior retains its originality as well and feels like you"??re sitting in a time machine where music was much better cars had character and Elton John was on the top charts with his hit "??Rocket Man"?. This potent 454cid will definitely make you feel like a rocket man when stabbing the gas pedal and taking flight with this powerful Vette. If you are looking for more than a cruiser this is the one for you. To view this 1971 Chevrolet Corvette in greater detail including 100+ HD photos and HD video please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For more information please call the Dallas/Fort Worth Showroom at 817-310-9400 or email at

description: Welcome to StreetDreamsTexas as we cruise into our 19th year in the classic and muscle car business Here's another highly optioned, low mileage Corvette from the Texas Hill Country's premier dealer of classic Corvettes. This beautifully pristine 'Vette (17,969 miles) offers the versatility to be shown, put in a collection, or driven for years to come. She's equipped with a tremendous amount of standard and optional features including a 350 ci V8 (L81), automatic transmission (MX3), power steering, power brakes, power driver's seat (A42, first year available), power door locks (AU3), power antenna (U75), removable glass roof panels (CC1), electric sport mirrors (DG7), Gymkhana suspension (FE7), 2.87 highway axle (HK1), cruise control (K35), aluminum wheels (N90), AM/FM cassette stereo (UM6), dual rear speakers (U81), two tone paint (ZO5; Bronze over Frost Beige), HD cooling (V08), luggage carrier (V54), and the rare (one of 916) trailer package (ZN1). This trailer package is desirable due to its rarity and the fact that it included a HD radiator, suspension, alternator, and battery. Most were ordered just for the heavy-duty components! An extremely rare combination of paint and options. Documentation includes original window sticker and build sheet. A very correct and clean example that's ready to show or GO! Street Dreams is a full service dealership that can assist with worldwide shipping, insurance, and financing options.

description: Welcome to StreetDreamsTexas as we celebrate our 18th year in the classic and muscle car business. We sold this car about 10 years ago.  She has been in a private collection all this time. The previous owner has cared for and given  this Corvette a  Hot new look. She was pretty rare to start with sporting that monster 427ci V8 and factory tri-power 400 hp T-Top Corvette backed by a Muncie  4-speed manual transmission, ''Kinda gives you goose bumps doesn't it'' The car has some tasteful upgrades to the style of the car check out the new cool wheels, bubble tail lights modern emblems and treated to a brighter yellow as compared to the original ''Butter Nut'' light yellow and a new black leather interior. Street Dreams is a full service dealership that can assist with worldwide delivery, insurance, and financing options.

Factory Smog Pump equipment Original tank sticker still on the tank, tons of reciepts for everything done to the car........ Call Austin at 863-226-8590

The Chevrolet Corvette, known colloquially as the Vette, or Chevy Corvette, is a sports car manufactured by Chevrolet. The car has been produced through seven generations. The first model, a convertible, was introduced at the GM Motorama in 1953 as a concept show car. Myron Scott is credited for naming the car after the type of small, maneuverable warship called a corvette. Originally built in Flint, Michigan and St. Louis, Missouri, the Corvette is currently manufactured in Bowling Green, Kentucky and is the official sports car of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this numbers matching 1973 Chevrolet Corvette L-82 Convertible for consideration. Finished in a lovely shade of Blue Green metallic, it has a very understated, but classy look. This particular Corvette has been in Kentucky for a while, then to Ohio and just recently Michigan.  The car has had a recent repaint in its original color and shows very well.  The bucket seats are covered in dark saddle leather ( code 422) and remain in good condition.  Other features include tilt wheel, L-82 engine, factory 15'' rally wheels, new alternator, 4 speed manual transmission,  owners manual

The top L-82 350cid V8 is a strong runner and sounds great. Factory specification states output at 250hp and it certainly feels like it. It has great pick up and is a joy to drive. The 4-speed manual transmission is somewhat hard to find and is a great feature in a sports car. The gorgeous exterior of this early model with its chrome bumpers is particularly desirable. A great find for those who love the 70's era Corvette and enjoy a uniquely beautiful ride to enjoy, call us with any questions you may have while it's still here!

Gr Auto Gallery, LLC and our sister company, Wheelz Sales and Leasing Inc. makes every effort to represent each vehicle accurately and with integrity. We also welcome third party inspections when necessary. Although we try to do our very best to be accurate in our description writing we are human and do make mistakes. Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.

For sale in our St. Louis showroom is a classic 1967 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible. There is just something about a C2 Corvette roadster that gets the American pride flowing. Finished in the beautiful color combination of red over black leather interior. This C2 roadster also features a stinger hood with a black stripe to bring the whole thing together. The paint and leather upholstery are both in very good condition and show very well. Side pipes have been installed to accentuate the side profile of the car along with the American Racing Torque Thrust aluminum/alloy wheels. Powering this 67"?? Corvette is a ZZ4 350 CID Crate V8 engine with an Edelbrock carburetor an MSD distributor chrome air cleaner and valve covers and an aluminum intake. An aluminum radiator has been employed to keep this drop top cool on those long hot summer days. A Keisler 5-speed manual transmission transfers the power to the pavement and provides a very driver friendly feel while shifting in the city or on the highway. With power steering 4-wheel disc brakes and dual master cylinder you can safely navigate this red beauty with ease. The odometer reads 34820 the actual mileage is unknown and there is approximately 10000 on the engine and transmission. Options for this 1967 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible include: AM/FM Radio with Cassette PlayerSeat Belts Manual Convertible Top Power Steering Leather Interior Radial Tires American Racing Aluminum/Alloy Wheels. This is a great example of an American icon in a fantastic color combination with a very driver friendly setup. To view this 1967 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our St. Louis showroom. For more information please call 618-271-3000 or email

This absolutely immaculate time capsule find is as well preserved and original as you'll ever find.  This would make an excellent candidate for Bloomington Survivor or even a Benchmark Award, this car is incredible!!  Still just like it left the factory with inspection tags on the suspension components, chalk/grease pen markings on the frame and under body, and simply stated, appears to have original everything!  I never thought I'd say we have a 77 Corvette worthy of any collection, but this is it!
